Onzzer’s documentation¶

All functions are here!!

Onzzer¶

class Onzzer.Fenetre_principale[source]¶

This is Onzzer’s window

accueil()[source]¶

This function creates the first page and includes styles. It retrieves the inscription in “LINEedit” and calls the “categorie” function.

Returns

It calls the “categorie” function.

Raises

TypeError

Example

self.searchButton.clicked.connect(self.categorie)

action_a_propos()[source]¶

Display information about the application and its developers.

action_clear()[source]¶

This function clear th line edith

action_openfolder()[source]¶

This function open forder

action_upload(titres)[source]¶

This function saves all tracks from an album in a .txt file.

Parameters

titres (list) – A list of track names

Returns

A .txt file containing the track names

categorie()[source]¶

This function calls different functions based on the selection in the drop-down list.

Returns

If the selection is “Album”, it calls the “recherche_album” function with the text from the line edit widget. If the selection is “Artiste”, it calls the “recherche_artiste” function with the text from the line edit widget.

Raises

TypeError

Example

select = self.catcombo.currentText() if select == “Album”:

self.recherche_album(self.line.text())

elif select == “Artiste” :

self.recherche_artiste(self.line.text())

verify the connexion with Internet if true: notink if falsh: he has got a message box with this message :

Parameters

Returns

None

None

Raises

TypeError if id_artiste is not a string

get_pistes_by_album(row, column, id_artiste)[source]¶

Retrieve the album tracks for the selected album and artist.

Parameters

  • row (int) – The row number of the selected album in the table.

  • column (int) – The column number of the selected album in the table.

  • id_artiste (str) – The ID of the selected artist.

Returns

None

Return type

None

id_album(row, recherche)[source]¶

This function retrieves the album id based on the selected row and search query.

Parameters

  • row (int) – The selected row in the table

  • recherche (str) – The search query entered by the user

Returns

The album id

Return type

int

Raises

TypeError

id_artiste(row, column, recherche)[source]¶

This function retrieves the number of the row when clicked, and retrieves the artist ID from the request_artistes module using the user’s input. :param recherche: The user’s input string :type recherche: str :returns: A list of all artists with the same name and their types :param row: The number of the row that was clicked :type row: int :returns: The number of the row that was clicked :rtype: listing of artists with the same name :raises: TypeError if any input is of the wrong type

recherche_album(recherche)[source]¶
Parameters

  • recherche –

  • recherche – The user’s input string

Returns

A table with the names and designations of all album with the given name

Return type

QTableWidget

Raises

TypeError

recherche_artiste(recherche)[source]¶

This function searches for artists with the given name and displays the information in a table.

Parameters

recherche (str) – The name of the artist to search for

Returns

A table with the names and designations of all artists with the given name

Return type

QTableWidget

Raises

TypeError

recherche_artiste(self, "celine dion")

The result of the search for artist “Celine Dion”¶

youtube(row, col, recherche)[source]¶

This function searches for a song on YouTube

Parameters

  • row (int) – the row of the selected song in the table

  • col (int) – the col of the selected song in the table

  • recherche (str) – the search term used to find the song

Returns

None

Request_albums¶

request_albums.get_album_artist_dic(album_name)[source]¶

This function receives an album name as input, and returns a dictionary containing the album name as key and the artist name as value.

Parameters

album_name (str) – The name of the album to search for.

Returns

A dictionary with album name as key and artist name as value.

Return type

dict

request_albums.get_album_name(album_name)[source]¶

This function receives an album name as input and returns the album name from MusicBrainz. :param album_name: The name of the album to search for. :type album_name: str :return: The album name. :rtype: str

request_albums.get_artist_list(album_name)[source]¶

This function receives an album name as input and returns a list of the artist name(s) associated with that album from MusicBrainz. :param album_name: The name of the album to search for. :type album_name: str :return: List of artist names. :rtype: list

request_albums.get_discographie(id_artiste)[source]¶

This function lists all the albums of a singer using their MusicBrainz ID. :param id_artiste: MusicBrainz ID of the artist :type id_artiste: str :returns: list of all singer’s albums :rtype: dict

youtube_search¶

youtube_search.yt_search(artiste, titre)[source]¶

This function buil query to lisen a tracks in Youtube (use trask title and singer name )

Parameters

  • param1 (str) – artiste

  • param2 (str) – titre

Returns

build a html link

Return type

str

Raises

TypeError

Example

def yt_search(self, celine Dion, Grand maman):

url_base = "https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query="
url_complet = url_base + celine dion + "+" +  Grand maman
